abstracts.cdata!:
Besides financing job-loss compensation,
            the privatization social support project, supported by a 250
            million dollars World Bank loan, has helped laid-off workers
            launch new businesses or find new jobs. The bulk of the
            project, however, helped people with lower technical skills
            and lesser prospects. As of June 2005, 30,741 unemployed and
            laid-off workers had received job insertion training,
            exceeding the World Bank's project target.
